posts.name: Tigerbytes
posts.cooked:
We are having an issue with our swerve drive ( YAGSL ) where the modules’ angle motors travel away from the desiredStates, rather than towards them. We have been following the tuning instructions and inversion stuff(still confused on what this is) from the YAGSL website. This is our first year using swerve drive, so were still trying to tune PID etc. If we could get any info on how to both tune swerve drive and solve our issue, it would be greatly appreciated.

A video of the issue being displayed in advantage scope is below(the robot is simply enabled, no input from controllers):

Is this simply a PID tuning issue, or something more complex?
I suspect that this occurs because you don’t pass values to the modules so they actually don’t know what to do. If you will share your code, I could help you with this issue.

posts.name: Tigerbytes
posts.cooked: We have tried swapping the inversion booleans in the module .json s, but it has not made a difference(other than the encoder one, but did not solve the issue). If anyone has any suggestions, please let us know!
Update to the latest version (its not the beta youre on). Of everything

posts.name: Gavin Matthews
posts.cooked:
In physicalproperties.json , gearRatio and diameter are zero, which seems odd.

Tigerbytes:

inversion stuff(still confused on what this is)

If motors are wired backwards or installed backwards, then motion will be in the opposite direction to that expected  by the code. Similarly with the encoders, the detected motion may be opposite to actual. Inversion is just a flag to fix this.

posts.name: Carter
posts.cooked: It looks like you’ve put the right and left stick values directly into the drive command. What if the sticks were jumping between very small numbers, making the swerve rapidly swich directions? Our controllers are acurate past about 0.07. Adding a way to get rid of those small numbers might work.
